title: In-app guide for replacing placeholder photos + graceful missing-image fallbacks

requirements.summary: Add a clearly labeled help entry point on the Gifts screen explaining how to replace Gift 2, Gift 3, and Final photo assets via config + generated assets folder.
acceptanceCriteria: On the Gifts screen, there is a visible control such as “How to add photos” / “Replace photos” that the user can click/tap.
Clicking/tapping the control opens an in-app help panel (modal/dialog/expandable section) with instructions written in English.
The instructions explicitly mention the folder path for images: frontend/public/assets/generated.
The instructions explicitly mention the config file and fields to edit: frontend/src/config/valentineContent.ts (HER_PHOTOS, COUPLE_PHOTOS, FINAL_COUPLE_PHOTO).
The instructions tell the user to use exact filenames (including extensions) and that the app reads images from /assets/generated/<filename> (matching the current implementation).

file_operations.description: Add a small, clearly labeled help entry point (e.g., “How to add/replace photos”) near the Gifts screen header and implement an in-app help panel (expandable section or dialog) that provides English instructions. The instructions must explicitly reference: (1) image folder path frontend/public/assets/generated, (2) config file frontend/src/config/valentineContent.ts and fields HER_PHOTOS, COUPLE_PHOTOS, FINAL_COUPLE_PHOTO, and (3) using exact filenames (including extensions) because the app reads from /assets/generated/<filename>. Use existing shadcn-ui composed components already imported in this screen (e.g., the Button component) for the entry point styling; do not modify any files under frontend/src/components/ui. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add graceful fallbacks for missing/broken images in Gift 2, Gift 3, and Final celebration photo so the UI remains usable and consistent.
acceptanceCriteria: If an image fails to load in Gift 2 or Gift 3, the UI shows a styled fallback area (matching the pink theme) with an English message like “Image not found: <filename>”.
If the final celebration photo fails to load, the UI shows a styled fallback area with an English message indicating the missing filename.
The rest of the flow remains usable and visually consistent when one or more images are missing.

file_operations.description: Create a reusable 2D UI helper component that renders an image from the generated assets path and switches to a pink-themed fallback UI when the image fails to load. The fallback should display an English message including the missing filename (e.g., “Image not found: <filename>”) and preserve layout via configurable aspect ratio / sizing so the Gifts and Final screens do not look broken.

Replace the direct usage in Gift 2 (HER_PHOTOS gallery) and Gift 3 (COUPLE_PHOTOS gallery) with the new SafeGeneratedImage component so broken/missing images show a styled fallback message that includes the filename, while keeping the existing gift unlock logic and flow unchanged.

Replace the direct usage for the FINAL_COUPLE_PHOTO with the SafeGeneratedImage component so a missing/broken final photo renders a pink-themed fallback area that states the missing filename, without changing the existing Final screen layout and animations.
